page.title: 19RELIGION IN NEW ELTHAM
page.content:
Children from Wyborne School asked local people about their religions.
Most people who regularly attend a place of worship go to the Church of England. Some people attend Roman Catholic Churches. There are very few Jewish people in the area and hardly any with Hindu or Moslem beliefs. Greenwich is probably the area of London with the smallest number of Hindus and Moslem and New Eltham,in the South Eastern corner of Greenwich, is perhaps the part with the smallest proportion of minority religions. Lots of people do not seem to be very interested in religions. .
